RACE.RACE_TEXT: MOUNTAINEER RACE TRACK AND RACE 1 1M Turf CR: 69. Claiming Purse 10800. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE ON THE TURF. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since July 21 Allowed 3 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000. (If necessary will be run SAM E DISTANCE Main Track.).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FORTUNA ADIUVAT tracked evenly circling out into upper stretch surging from mid track being carried out while engaging late clearing gamely. CAGUA well rated vied on the far turn wresting a short lead while four deep in upper stretch angling out to tighten foe when confronted late ceding in the fonal yards. HERE COMES JIGS stalked close up chasing on the far turn cutting the corner to vie from the rail down the stretch hanging late. LAUGH IT OFF saved ground to the far turn swinging out in upper stretch moving up late six wide. DIXIE'S DANCE away alertly set the pace through the backside being hooked on the far turn extending on the inside in upper stretch weakening late. GRAND VENUS stalked the pace pressing to put a head in front abreast rival on the far turn then weakened in upper stretch. LELAWALA faded on the backside failing to menace. WICKED VALENTINE was always outrun. VALERIE FIRST was never involved.

ENTRY.NAME: Fortuna Adiuvat
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked evenly, circled out to lane, carried wider late cleared

ENTRY.NAME: Wicked Valentine
ENTRY.COMMENT: always outrun

ENTRY.NAME: Laugh It Off
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground, swung out into lane, moved up late 6 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Dixie's Dance
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, set pace, hooked far turn, extended inside, short

ENTRY.NAME: Cagua
ENTRY.COMMENT: well rated, vied far turn, led four deep lane, angled out ceded

ENTRY.NAME: Lelawala
ENTRY.COMMENT: early retreat, failed to menace,

ENTRY.NAME: Valerie First
ENTRY.COMMENT: never involved

ENTRY.NAME: Grand Venus
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, pressed abreast far turn, weakened lane

ENTRY.NAME: Here Comes Jigs
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, chased to upper stretch, hung late on rail

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MOUNTAINEER RACE TRACK AND RACE 2 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 61. Maiden Claiming Purse 7700. FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 116 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HUNTER JUMPER pressured the pace dueling abreast rival through the turn wresting the lead in upper stretch pulling away late. MYSTIC MINISTER sent hard pressed the pace dueling inside of rival to upper stretch ceding late hanging on a weary second. CIRCLE INDY a step slow early raced evenly on the turn then down the stretch lacking more. F F READY OR NOT faded on the turn. MY WROTE dropped off on the turn. PEINADITO folded up on the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Circle Indy
ENTRY.COMMENT: step slow, evenly turn, lacked surge lane, held spot

ENTRY.NAME: Peinadito
ENTRY.OWNER: MM Racing LLC and Estrella Jose E
ENTRY.COMMENT: folded up on the turn

ENTRY.NAME: Mystic Minister
ENTRY.OWNER: Quarter Pole Investments LLC and Fletcher Kevin
ENTRY.COMMENT: sent hard, pressed pace, dueled into to lane, ceded, saved place

ENTRY.NAME: Hunter Jumper
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, dueled abreast to lane, pulled away late

ENTRY.NAME: F F Ready Or Not
ENTRY.COMMENT: faded on the turn

ENTRY.NAME: My Wrote
ENTRY.COMMENT: dropped off on turn

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MOUNTAINEER RACE TRACK AND RACE 3 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 57. Maiden Special Weight Purse 16500. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 118 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MASHKA pressed between horses on the turn ceding a clear lead to rival in upper stretch digging deep to surge clear late. BAYTOWN ANGEL chased a trio through the turn angling out in upper stretch responding late drifting in some while finishing well. SPENDING CUTS away alertly contested the pace dueling along the inside through the turn edging to a short lead in upper stretch faltering late. MISTY OCEAN slow early lost ground to upper stretch finishing evenly seven wide. MACI'S WORLD dropped well back early. MOON RIDGE sent hard pressed all out while three deep on the turn wilting in upper stretch. BIG RED WAVE saved ground showing little.

ENTRY.NAME: Maci's World
ENTRY.COMMENT: dropped well back early

ENTRY.NAME: Spending Cuts
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, pressed pace, edged clear top lane, faltered,

ENTRY.NAME: Mashka
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed between, ceded lead top lane, surged past late

ENTRY.NAME: Moon Ridge
ENTRY.COMMENT: sent hard, all out three deep turn, used up,

ENTRY.NAME: Big Red Wave
ENTRY.COMMENT: showed little

ENTRY.NAME: Misty Ocean
ENTRY.OWNER: Chapman James K and Stuart Tsujimoto LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow early, lost ground to lane, finished evenly 7 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Baytown Angel
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased trio through turn, angled out lane, finished well

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MOUNTAINEER RACE TRACK AND RACE 4 1M Dirt CR: 75. Claiming Purse 7900. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE AUGUST 21, 2022 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 116 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000 (W V A Bred Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: RY'S REVENGE broke sharply gainging the early lead moving away on pace racing off the inside building a commanding margin in upper stretch angling out late. PARADE GRAND stalked the pace chasing as the leader got away on the far turn would continue on down the lane responding to save place. FIND YOUR BOAZ bumped at the break would lose ground through the far turn vying six wide down the lane hanging late. CAPTAIN RILEY raced evenly throughout lacking more. GALLIPOLIS raced mid pack tiring to upper stretch. PICCADILLY BEAU folded up after a half mile.

ENTRY.NAME: Captain Riley
ENTRY.COMMENT: evenly, lacked more

ENTRY.NAME: Find Your Boaz
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped break, lost ground, vied 6 wide lane, hung

ENTRY.NAME: Gallipolis
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, tired lane

ENTRY.NAME: Ry's Revenge
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, hustled off on lead, to upper stretch, had more

ENTRY.NAME: Piccadilly Beau
ENTRY.COMMENT: folded after a half mile

ENTRY.NAME: Parade Grand
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, chased loose leader to lane, no match, saved place

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MOUNTAINEER RACE TRACK AND RACE 5 6F Dirt CR: 49. Maiden Special Weight Purse 16500. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 116 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. (Preference To Horses That Have Not Started For Less Than $15,000).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MACHEN IT RAIN pressed to a short lead on the turn edging clear in upper stretch holding off inside pressure late. WATCHING SNOW FLY pressed early then chased on the turn saving ground to upper stretch bidding gamely late along the rail. LET'S ROCK pressed the pace through the turnh ceding to rival in upper stretch weakening late. WHY WINCHILL WHY a step slow through the turn came five wide into upper stretch finishing evenly. SWORD OF DAMOCLES played no factor. CASH IS MONEY ducked out at the break. CLASSY REY DE ORO was always outrun.

ENTRY.OWNER: Miotke Elise Miotke Matthew and Energy Racing Stable LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: always outrun,

ENTRY.NAME: Sword of Damocles
ENTRY.COMMENT: played no factor,

ENTRY.NAME: Why Winchill Why
ENTRY.COMMENT: step slow, 5 wide into lane, finished evenly,

ENTRY.COMMENT: preesed early, saved ground to lane, bid gamely on rail

ENTRY.NAME: Let's Rock
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, ceded lane, weakened late

ENTRY.NAME: Machen It Rain
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed to lead on turn, cleared top lane held to inside pressure

ENTRY.NAME: Cash Is Money

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MOUNTAINEER RACE TRACK AND RACE 6 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 83. Allowance Purse 21200. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 21 Allowed 3 lbs. (Maiden Or Claiming Races For $15,000 Or Less Not Considered In Estimating Allowances)(W V A Bre d Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: COLLECTORATE rushed up to vie three deep at the quarter pole dueling into upper stretch shaking clear late. LUCKY NINETEEN pressed early then chased on the turn saving ground to upper stretch vying all out from the rail saving place on the wire. SUTTON BREEZE led early then deuled from the inside on the turn extending down the lane ceding to outside pressure contonuing to battle to the wire. JEREMY'S JET pressed between horses on the turn dueling into upper stretch extending late being outfinished. LITTLE VAQUERO was always a step slow.

ENTRY.OWNER: Diamond Oak Stable and Splurgin Racing
ENTRY.COMMENT: led early, dueled inside on turn, extended lane, no match late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MOUNTAINEER RACE TRACK AND RACE 7 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 91. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 18800. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, OR STARTER OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $12,500. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 21 Allowed 3 lbs. C laiming Price $12,500 (Claiming Races For $10,000 Or Less Not Considered In Estimating Allowances)(W V A Bred Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ALLEN CAN DO IT chased the pace on the turn angling out into upper stretch surging clear late from mid track. ALFIE SOLOMONS pressed the pace leading on the turn extending into upper stretch ceding to outside pressure holding well for place. BAAGY broke slowly rushing up splitting horses to vied on the turn extending inside of rivals in upper stretch weakening late. I'M A COOL MAN pressed early then weakened along the inside to upper stretch. SHELTOWEE'S BALI faded on the turn.

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MOUNTAINEER RACE TRACK AND RACE 8 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 58. Claiming Purse 7800. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 21 Allowed 3 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000 (W V A Bred Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TEQUILA SUNSET raced evenly through the turn coming six wide in upper stretch surging up in the final strides. BELLAVALENCIA chased through the turn vying four wide down the lane surging in the final yards. HIGH DOLLAR DATE slow early lagged on the turn responding in upper stretch surging from the inside to be right there at the wire. LADY OCEAN sent clear set the pace through the turn digging in from the three path down the lane faltering late between horses. SECRET SEDUCTION played no factor. ARISTA THE CAT chased the pace through the turn fading in upper stretch. SISTER JOANN hustled inside chased to the quarter pole then gave way in upper stretch. MY BRIDGET VERDOT was always outrun.
